Symptom: Do you feel like your emotions are all-or-nothing — either flooding or numb?
Echo-Friendly Description: Like there’s no middle gear — it’s silence or storm?

Symptom: Do you keep detailed mental or physical ‘safety routines’ — even if others don’t understand them?
Echo-Friendly Description: Like certain habits or checks make you feel safe or in control?

Symptom: Do you mentally prepare for conversations — like you rehearse what to say in advance?
Echo-Friendly Description: Like real-time dialogue feels risky or unpredictable unless prepped?

Symptom: Do you often feel like people misunderstand your tone — even when you’re trying to be clear?
Echo-Friendly Description: Like your intent gets lost and you feel guilty, awkward, or frustrated?

Symptom: Do you have moments of intense self-hate or disgust — even if they don’t last long?
Echo-Friendly Description: Like a switch flips and you turn against yourself hard?

Symptom: Do you sometimes feel like you’re just ‘playing the role’ of being okay — especially around others?
Echo-Friendly Description: Like it’s all performance until you’re finally alone?

Symptom: Do you start new projects or ideas with excitement — but abandon them quickly?
Echo-Friendly Description: Like your brain runs on bursts, then fizzles out?

Symptom: Do you feel tension in your body most of the time — like your muscles are always slightly braced?
Echo-Friendly Description: Like your nervous system never fully settles, even when you're safe?

Symptom: Do you tend to mentally script or over-plan social interactions ahead of time?
Echo-Friendly Description: Like being spontaneous feels unsafe or risky in conversation?

Symptom: Do you ever feel like you're chasing a version of yourself you can’t quite reach?
Echo-Friendly Description: Like there's a ‘you’ you’re supposed to be, and you’re always falling short?
